duties_responsibilities.duty: Assess, plan, and implement care for patients across the continuum of malignant hematology and stem cell transplantation.
Direct and oversee the care delivered by Patient Care Technicians and other healthcare team members.
Adhere to hospital and department infection control policies and effectively communicate with peers to resolve conflict.
Protect the patient's dignity, rights, and privacy.
Collaborate with physicians and other health care providers to provide direct and indirect care to patients.
Conduct and reinforce patient education, including treatment plan/regimen, symptom management, and available resources at home or at the facility.
Administer medications and care for patients with IV lines, central lines, and ports.
Read, interpret, and operate cardiac and other invasive and noninvasive monitors, recognize normal/abnormal rhythms/trends, and institute appropriate interventions within 6 months of hire.
Effectively communicate to manage complex patient and family needs.

education_certification.credential: Associate Degree in Nursing or equivalent; Bachelor of Science in Nursing (BSN) preferred
Basic Life Support (BLS) Certification, American Heart Association (AHA) training site, American Safety & Health Institute, or Red Cross BLS certification required upon hire.
Advanced Cardiovascular Life Support (ACLS) Certification, American Heart Association (AHA) ACLS certification required 30 days from the date of hire and renewed every two years.

Oncology Nursing Society (ONS) Fundamentals of Chemotherapy Immunotherapy/Biotherapy Provider Certificate preferred upon hire, required before completion of nursing orientation, with renewal every two years.

Oncology Nursing Society (ONS) Hematopoietic Stem Cell Transplantation course within 30 days of hire. Exempt with proof of previous ONS equivalent course or Blood & Marrow Transplant Certified Nurse (BMTCN) certification.
